definitions: native or inhabitant of Uruguay, a South American country located between Brazil and Argentina
variant of Spanish language spoken in Uruguay characterized by Italian influence and unique vocabulary
examples: The Uruguayan diplomat represented his country at the United Nations conference
Many Uruguayans celebrate their independence day with traditional music and dance
Her Uruguayan accent revealed traces of Italian from immigrant families
The Uruguayan dialect includes unique expressions not found in other Spanish varieties

definitions: person who shows people to their seats at theaters, events, or religious services
member of a wedding party who guides guests to appropriate seating
person who introduces or initiates a new era, trend, or significant change
examples: The usher directed patrons to their seats before the concert began
Church ushers greeted congregants at the door every Sunday morning
The wedding ushers wore matching gray suits and boutonnieres
She asked her college roommate to serve as an usher
The invention of the internet ushered in the digital information age
These artists were ushers of the modern abstract movement

definitions: western state of the United States known for its Mormon heritage, national parks, and desert landscapes
indigenous Native American people originally inhabiting the Great Basin region
examples: Utah became the 45th state to join the United States in 1896
Salt Lake City serves as the capital and largest city of Utah
The Utah tribe traditionally lived in what is now Colorado and Utah
Utah people spoke a Numic language of the Uto-Aztecan family

definitions: imagined place or state of things where everything is perfect, especially in social and political organization
book written by Thomas More in 1516 describing an ideal island society
examples: Many philosophers have envisioned their own versions of utopia throughout history
The commune attempted to create a utopia based on equality and shared resources
Thomas More's Utopia criticized European society through its fictional island narrative
Students studied Utopia as part of their Renaissance literature course

definitions: person who believes in or pursues idealistic and often impractical social reforms
advocate or designer of ideal but unrealistic social and political schemes
examples: The utopian believed technology would solve all of humanity's problems
Many utopians of the 19th century founded experimental communities
Socialist utopians imagined societies without private property or class divisions
The architect was dismissed as a utopian for his radical city designs

definitions: member of a Turkic ethnic group primarily living in China's Xinjiang region and Central Asia
Turkic language spoken by the Uygur people with Arabic script influences
examples: The Uygur merchant sold traditional carpets at the Kashgar bazaar
Many Uygurs maintain their distinct cultural traditions despite modern pressures
She studied Uygur to better understand Central Asian linguistic connections
The Uygur script evolved from ancient Sogdian writing systems

definitions: native or inhabitant of Uzbekistan, a Central Asian country formerly part of the Soviet Union
Turkic language spoken in Uzbekistan and neighboring regions written in Latin script
examples: The Uzbek family celebrated Navruz with traditional music and food
Many Uzbeks work in Russia and send remittances back home
Uzbek became the official language after independence from the Soviet Union
The Uzbek language has borrowed many words from Persian and Arabic

definitions: landlocked country in Central Asia bordered by Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Tajikistan, Afghanistan, and Turkmenistan
examples: Uzbekistan gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991
The ancient Silk Road passed through what is now Uzbekistan

definitions: compact Israeli submachine gun designed by Uziel Gal widely used by military and security forces
examples: The security detail carried Uzis for close protection assignments
The Uzi became one of the most recognizable firearms of the 20th century

definitions: large tank or tub used for holding liquids especially in industrial processes
value-added tax charged on goods and services at each production stage
examples: The brewery fermented beer in enormous stainless steel vats
Workers cleaned the dyeing vats between different color batches
The VAT rate increased from 15 to 20 percent last year
Small businesses struggled with complex VAT reporting requirements

definitions: videocassette recorder that plays and records television programs on magnetic tape cassettes
examples: They programmed the VCR to record their favorite show while away
The family's old VCR still worked despite being twenty years old

definitions: Veterans of Foreign Wars, American organization for military veterans who served overseas
examples: The local VFW post organized a Memorial Day parade downtown
She joined the VFW after returning from her deployment in Afghanistan

definitions: very high frequency radio waves between 30 and 300 megahertz used for broadcasting and communication
examples: Marine radios operate on VHF channels for ship-to-ship communication
The television station broadcast on VHF channel 7

definitions: Roman numeral representing the number seven, often used in formal numbering systems
examples: Chapter VII covered the medieval period of European history
King Henry VII ruled England from 1485 to 1509

definitions: Roman numeral representing the number eight, commonly used in formal documents and titles
examples: Pope Clement VIII served during the late Renaissance period
Article VIII of the constitution addresses judicial procedures

definitions: very important person who receives special treatment or privileges due to status or influence
examples: The VIP guests sat in the exclusive lounge before boarding
Security cleared a special entrance for the VIP arrivals

definitions: very low frequency radio waves between 3 and 30 kilohertz used for long-distance communication
examples: Submarines use VLF transmissions to communicate while submerged
The VLF signal penetrated deep underground and underwater

definitions: major tradition within Hinduism that venerates Vishnu and his avatars as the supreme deity
examples: Vaishnavism represents one of the largest branches of modern Hinduism
The temple practiced Vaishnavism with daily prayers to Lord Vishnu

definitions: card or gift given to express romantic love on Valentine's Day
person to whom one sends romantic greetings or with whom one is romantically involved
Christian saint associated with courtly love commemorated on February 14th
examples: She received dozens of valentines from secret admirers at school
The store sold heart-shaped valentines with romantic messages
He asked her to be his valentine at the office party
My valentine surprised me with flowers and chocolate
Saint Valentine secretly performed Christian weddings for Roman soldiers
The feast of Saint Valentine became associated with romantic love

definitions: great hall in Norse mythology where warriors who died in battle feast with Odin
examples: Vikings believed brave warriors would enter Valhalla after death
The saga described Valhalla's golden shields and endless feasting

definitions: female figure in Norse mythology who chooses which warriors die in battle and escorts them to Valhalla
examples: The valkyrie descended from the sky to claim fallen heroes
Wagner's opera features valkyries riding through storms on winged horses

definitions: major coastal city in British Columbia, Canada, known for its natural beauty and multicultural population
large island off the west coast of Canada in British Columbia
examples: Vancouver hosted the 2010 Winter Olympic Games
Many film productions choose Vancouver for its diverse locations
Vancouver Island attracts tourists with its mild climate and outdoor activities
The capital of British Columbia sits on Vancouver Island

definitions: person who deliberately destroys or damages public or private property
member of ancient Germanic people who sacked Rome in 455 CE
examples: Vandals spray-painted graffiti on the historic monument overnight
The school installed cameras to catch vandals damaging property
The Vandals migrated from Scandinavia through Europe to North Africa
Historians debate whether Vandals truly destroyed more than other invaders

definitions: island nation in the South Pacific Ocean consisting of roughly 80 islands formerly known as New Hebrides
examples: Vanuatu gained independence from joint British-French rule in 1980
Tourism and agriculture form the backbone of Vanuatu's economy

definitions: official residence of the Pope and administrative center of the Roman Catholic Church
smallest independent nation-state in the world located within Rome, Italy
examples: The Vatican houses priceless art including Michelangelo's Sistine Chapel ceiling
Cardinals gathered at the Vatican to elect a new Pope
Vatican City covers only 121 acres within Rome's boundaries
The Vatican maintains diplomatic relations with most world nations

definitions: ancient sacred texts of Hinduism written in Sanskrit containing hymns, philosophy, and ritual guidance
examples: The Rig Veda contains over a thousand hymns to various deities
Hindu priests memorized and transmitted the Vedas orally for centuries

definitions: philosophical tradition based on the Upanishads focusing on the nature of reality and self-realization
examples: Vedanta teaches that individual consciousness and universal consciousness are one
The swami established a Vedanta center to spread Hindu philosophy

definitions: brightest star in the constellation Lyra and fifth brightest star in Earth's night sky
fertile lowland or meadow, especially in Spain or Spanish-speaking regions
examples: Vega serves as a reference point for measuring stellar brightness
Ancient civilizations used Vega for navigation and calendar-making
The farmers cultivated crops in the river's vega for generations
Granada's vega produces abundant fruits and vegetables

definitions: brand name for hook-and-loop fastener consisting of two strips that adhere when pressed together
examples: The child's shoes used Velcro straps instead of laces
Astronauts rely on Velcro to secure items in zero gravity

definitions: native or inhabitant of Venice, the historic Italian city built on water
horizontal slatted window blind that can be adjusted to control light
examples: The Venetian merchant traded goods throughout the Mediterranean
Venetian artists pioneered the use of oil painting techniques
She adjusted the Venetian blinds to reduce the afternoon glare
The office installed new Venetian blinds for better privacy

definitions: country on the northern coast of South America bordered by Colombia, Brazil, and Guyana
examples: Venezuela possesses the world's largest proven oil reserves
The Angel Falls in Venezuela is the world's highest uninterrupted waterfall

definitions: native or inhabitant of Venezuela, a South American country known for oil production
examples: The Venezuelan family emigrated during the economic crisis
Many Venezuelans celebrate their independence day on July 5th

definitions: historic city in northeastern Italy built on islands in a lagoon famous for canals and architecture
examples: Venice attracts millions of tourists to see its canals and gondolas
The Venice Biennale showcases contemporary art from around the world

definitions: diagram showing mathematical or logical relationships between sets using overlapping circles
examples: The teacher used a Venn diagram to compare characteristics of mammals and birds
The Venn diagram revealed surprising overlaps between the two data sets

definitions: city in northeastern France on the Meuse River with medieval fortifications
site of the longest and bloodiest battle of World War I in 1916
examples: Verdun's cathedral dates back to the 10th century
The city of Verdun recovered slowly from wartime devastation
The Battle of Verdun lasted 303 days with massive casualties
Verdun became a symbol of French determination in World War I

definitions: ancient Roman poet who wrote the Aeneid, also spelled Virgil, considered Rome's greatest poet
examples: Vergil's Aeneid tells the legendary story of Rome's founding
Dante chose Vergil as his guide through Hell in the Divine Comedy

definitions: northeastern state of the United States known for maple syrup, skiing, and rural landscapes
examples: Vermont produces more maple syrup than any other US state
Bernie Sanders served as Vermont's senator for many years

definitions: auxiliary scale used with measuring instruments to obtain precise fractional readings between main scale divisions
examples: The machinist used a vernier caliper to measure the part precisely
The vernier scale allowed measurements accurate to thousandths of an inch

definitions: historic city in northern Italy's Veneto region famous as the setting of Romeo and Juliet
examples: Tourists visit Verona to see the supposed balcony of Juliet
Verona's Roman amphitheater still hosts opera performances today

definitions: Italian brand of scooter manufactured by Piaggio, iconic symbol of Italian style and urban mobility
examples: She rode her vintage Vespa through the narrow streets of Rome
The classic Vespa design has remained popular since the 1940s

definitions: evening prayer service in Christian liturgical traditions, especially Catholic and Orthodox churches
examples: The monks gathered for vespers as the sun began to set
The cathedral's vesper bells called the faithful to evening prayer

definitions: Roman goddess of hearth and home whose sacred flame was tended by virgin priestesses
one of the largest asteroids in the solar system located in the main asteroid belt
examples: The temple of Vesta housed Rome's eternal flame
Vestal virgins maintained Vesta's sacred fire for over a thousand years
The spacecraft Dawn orbited Vesta to study its composition
Vesta is the brightest asteroid visible from Earth

definitions: brand name for sildenafil citrate, a medication used to treat erectile dysfunction and pulmonary hypertension
examples: The doctor prescribed Viagra to treat his erectile dysfunction
Viagra revolutionized the treatment of male sexual health issues

definitions: spa town in central France famous for its mineral springs and water
French government that collaborated with Nazi Germany during World War II
examples: Vichy water has been bottled and exported for centuries
The spa treatments in Vichy attract health-conscious tourists
The Vichy regime controlled southern France from 1940 to 1944
Many French citizens opposed the Vichy government's collaboration

definitions: city in western Mississippi on bluffs overlooking the Mississippi River
decisive Civil War siege in 1863 that gave the Union control of the Mississippi River
examples: Vicksburg serves as an important port on the Mississippi River
The city of Vicksburg preserves many antebellum mansions
The siege of Vicksburg lasted 47 days before Confederate surrender
Grant's victory at Vicksburg split the Confederacy in two

definitions: Queen of the United Kingdom from 1837 to 1901 who gave her name to an era
southeastern state of Australia with Melbourne as its capital city
name of various cities, lakes, and geographic features worldwide
examples: Queen Victoria ruled the British Empire for over 63 years
The Victorian era saw massive industrial and social changes
Victoria produces much of Australia's dairy and agricultural products
Melbourne serves as the capital city of Victoria state
Lake Victoria is Africa's largest lake by surface area
Victoria Falls forms the border between Zambia and Zimbabwe

definitions: relating to the reign of Queen Victoria or the distinctive culture, values, and styles of that era
person from the Australian state of Victoria or the Victorian era
examples: Victorian architecture features ornate details and steep rooflines
Victorian morality emphasized strict social codes and propriety
Many Victorians commute daily from suburbs to Melbourne
The Victorian displayed typical British reserve and formality

definitions: capital and largest city of Austria, famous for its imperial history, classical music, and coffee culture
examples: Vienna served as the seat of the Habsburg Empire for centuries
Mozart and Beethoven composed many masterpieces while living in Vienna

definitions: country in Southeast Asia on the Indochina Peninsula bordered by China, Laos, and Cambodia
examples: Vietnam unified as a socialist republic in 1976 after decades of war
The Mekong Delta in southern Vietnam produces much of the country's rice

definitions: native or inhabitant of Vietnam, a Southeast Asian country on the Indochina Peninsula
official language of Vietnam belonging to the Austroasiatic language family
examples: The Vietnamese community celebrates Tet as their most important holiday
Many Vietnamese refugees settled in America after the Vietnam War
Vietnamese uses six tones to distinguish word meanings
She studied Vietnamese to communicate with her grandmother
